rubric_items.passed_description: The submission includes complete notebook files as `.ipynb`: "2_Plagiarism_Feature_Engineering" and "3_Training_a_Model". And the test and helper files are included: "problem_unittests.py", "helpers.py". The submission also includes a training directory `source_sklearn` OR `source_pytorch`.
rubric_items.criteria: Are all required files submitted?

rubric_items.passed_description: All the unit tests in project have passed.
rubric_items.criteria: Are all unit tests passed?

rubric_items.passed_description: The function `numerical_dataframe` should be complete, reading in the original file_information.csv file and returning a DataFrame of information with a numerical `Category` column and new, `Class` column.
rubric_items.criteria: For each data point, is a class label added and the `Category` converted to a numerical value?

rubric_items.passed_description: There is no code requirement here, just make sure you run all required cells to create a `complete_df` that holds pre-processed file text data and `Datatype` information.
rubric_items.criteria: Is a `complete_df` created?

rubric_items.passed_description: The function `calculate_containment` should be complete, taking in the necessary information and returning a single, normalized containment value for a given answer file.
rubric_items.criteria: Have you implemented a function to calculate containment?

rubric_items.passed_description: Provide an answer to the question about containment feature calculation.
rubric_items.criteria: Did you answer the question about containment feature calculation?

rubric_items.passed_description: The function `lcs_norm_word` should be complete, taking in two texts and returning a single, normalized LCS value.
rubric_items.criteria: Have you implemented a function to calculate the longest common subsequence of words between two texts?

rubric_items.passed_description: Define an n-gram range to calculate multiple containment features. Run the code to calculate one LCS feature, and create a DataFrame that holds all of these feature calculations.
rubric_items.criteria: Have you created a DataFrame that holds at least 6 similarity features for all the text data?

sections.name: Notebook 2: Train and Test Files Created

rubric_items.passed_description: Complete the function `train_test_data`. This should return only a _selection_ of training and test features, and corresponding class labels.
rubric_items.criteria: Have you implemented the code to create train/test features and labels?

rubric_items.passed_description: Select a few features to use in your final training and test data.
rubric_items.criteria: Have you selected a few "good" features to include in the train/test data?

rubric_items.passed_description: Provide an answer that describes why you chose your final features.
rubric_items.criteria: Did you answer the question about selecting features?

rubric_items.passed_description: Implement the `make_csv` function. The class labels for train/test data should be in the first column of the csv file; selected features in the rest of the columns. Run the rest of the cells to create `train.csv` and `test.csv` files.
rubric_items.criteria: Have you made train/test csv files?

rubric_items.passed_description: Upload the `train.csv` file to a specified directory in an S3 bucket.
rubric_items.criteria: Have you uploaded your training data to S3?

rubric_items.passed_description: Complete at least _one_ of the `train.py` files by instantiating a model, and training it in the main if statement. If you are using a custom PyTorch model, you will have to complete the `model.py` file, as well (you do not have to do so if you choose to use an imported sklearn model).
rubric_items.criteria: Have you completed a training script?

rubric_items.passed_description: Define a custom sklearn OR PyTorch estimator by passing in the required arguments.
rubric_items.criteria: Have you defined a custom estimator?

rubric_items.passed_description: Fit your estimator (from the previous rubric item) to the training data you stored in S3.
rubric_items.criteria: Have you trained your model?

sections.name: Notebook 3: Deploying and Evaluating a Model

rubric_items.passed_description: Deploy the model and create a `predictor` by specifying a deployment instance.
rubric_items.criteria: Have you deployed the trained model?

rubric_items.passed_description: Pass test data to your deployed `predictor` and evaluate its performance by comparing its predictions to the true, class labels. Your model should get at least 90% test accuracy.
rubric_items.criteria: Is the test accuracy of your model greater than 90%?

rubric_items.passed_description: Provide an answer to the two model-related questions.
rubric_items.criteria: Did you answer the two questions about model metrics and design considerations?

rubric_items.passed_description: Run the code to clean up your final model resources.
rubric_items.criteria: Did you delete your model endpoint?
